text.description: Open Thread: Silvio Berlusconi's wife is furious - so furious that she wrote a letter to a newspaper complaining about her husband.
text.title: A woman scorned

main.p: Silvio Berlusconi. Photographer: AP Photo/Pier Paolo Cito

quote.hi: "With respect and discretion I have faced up to the inevitable conflicts and painful moments that a long matrimonial relationship brings with it.

"I am now writing to express my reaction to the statements made by my husband during the gala dinner that followed the award of the Telegatti [TV prizes] in which addressing certain of the ladies present he allowed himself to [make] remarks that are unacceptable to me: 'If I weren't married already I'd marry you in a trice', 'I'd go anywhere with you' ...

main.p: With these words - published in a national newspaper - Veronica Lario, wife of former Italian prime minister Silvio Berlusconi, denounced her husband's flirtatious behaviour and demanded an apology.
She says she decided to ask for a public apology "not having received one privately".

So, was she right to do it? Would you complain about your partner's indiscretions to a newspaper? Would you write a more venomous letter than Veronica's? Or would you find some other way to take your revenge?
